newsitem.title: JAPAN: Daiwa, Nikko, Yamaichi seen to cut forecasts-paper.
newsitem.headline: Daiwa, Nikko, Yamaichi seen to cut forecasts-paper.

text.p: Daiwa Securities Co Ltd, Nikko Securities Co Ltd and Yamaichi Securities Co Ltd are expected to lower their forecasts for parent current profit in the six months to September 30, a Japanese business daily said on Tuesday.

The Nihon Keizai Shimbun said half-year parent current profits at Daiwa and Nikko would be smaller than those of the same period a year ago. It said Yamaichi may not be able to post any current profit in the half-year period.
Many second-tier securities houses may post half-year losses in 1996/97, the paper said.
The paper said the poor business performances were due to a sluggish stock market.
But it said industry leader Nomura Securities Co Ltd would post a larger half-year parent current profit than in the same period last year due to an expected rise in profits from bond trading.

The paper saw Daiwa's half-year parent current profit at 25 billion yen against an actual profit of 27.5 billion yen a year ago. It expects Nikko's half-year parent current profit at 20 billion yen, against an actual profit of 25.5 billion yen a year ago.
The paper said Yamaichi would post nil half-year parent current profit. The company had a half-year parent current profit in 1995/96 of 5.2 billion yen.
Nomura would post half-year parent current profit of 50 billion yen in 1996/97 against half-year profit of 32.1 billion yen a year ago, the paper said.
